faqs.question: How does the Armature Validation System work?
faqs.answer:
The armature validation system helps ensure your avatar's skeleton is properly set up for various platforms and features three validation modes:

### Strict Mode
Provides comprehensive validation including:
- Checks for all essential bones (hips, spine, chest, neck, head)
- Verifies correct bone hierarchy (e.g., spine properly connected to hips)
- Ensures proper left/right bone symmetry
- Validates bone naming conventions

### Basic Mode
Performs essential checks:
- Verifies presence of core bones
- Basic structure validation
- Allows more flexibility for non-standard avatars

### No Validation
- Bypasses all validation checks
- Useful for experimental or non-humanoid avatars
- Warning: May cause issues with some features

[warning]Using No Validation mode may result in incompatibility with certain platforms or features not working as expected.[/warning]

[note]The validation system supports multiple naming conventions and languages, making it compatible with avatars from various sources.[/note]

faqs.question: How do the Pose Mode Functions work?
faqs.answer:
The pose mode system offers powerful tools for creating and managing poses:

### Start/Stop Pose Mode
When starting pose mode:
- Automatically selects the armature
- Enables bone manipulation
- Preserves existing transformations

When stopping pose mode:
- Safely clears all pose adjustments
- Returns bones to rest position
- Preserves any saved poses

### Creating Shape Keys from Poses
This powerful feature allows you to:
- Convert any pose into a blendable shape key
- Create multiple variations of the same pose
- Combine poses with existing shape keys
- Preserve vertex weights and deformations

### Applying Poses as Rest Position
This function permanently changes your avatar's default pose:
- Updates the base skeleton position
- Adjusts all connected meshes
- Preserves shape keys and their deformations
- Maintains proper weight painting

[warning]Applying a pose as rest position is permanent and cannot be undone after saving. Always make a backup before using this feature.[/warning]

[note]Shape keys created from poses can be used for creating dynamic animations or blended expressions.[/note]

faqs.question: How does the Import/Export System work?
faqs.answer:
The import/export system is designed to handle various avatar formats with specialized optimizations:

### Import System
Supports multiple formats with automatic optimization:

**Standard Formats:**
- FBX: Full support with automatic bone orientation
- OBJ: Includes materials and textures
- GLTF/GLB: Complete VRM support

**MMD Formats:**
- PMX: Full support for MMD features
  - Automatic bone naming conversion
  - Material optimization
  - Shape key preservation
  - Weight transfer optimization
- PMD: Legacy format support with automatic upgrades

[View complete list of supported formats](https://avatartoolkit.xyz/wiki.html?version=0.1.2#what-file-formats-are-supported-by-the-avatar-toolkit)

### Export System
Offers two main export paths:

**FBX Export:**
- Optimized for various platforms
- Preserves all materials and textures
- Maintains bone hierarchies
- Includes shape keys and weights

**Resonite Export:**
- Specialized format for Resonite platform
- Automatic material conversion
- Optimized texture compression
- Platform-specific optimizations

[info]The system automatically handles texture conversion and compression during export to ensure compatibility.[/info]

[warning]Some features may not transfer between all formats. Check platform requirements before exporting.[/warning]

[note]For best results, use the recommended export format for your target platform.[/note]
